page.title: 16A Ghost Story
page.content: It is told in the village that one dark, stormy night, about 100 years ago,a farmer had to return over the Holmes,(water meadows near the Trent). He had taken refreshment at the Lord Nelson Inn and he lay dozing on his cart as his horses found their way home. The floods had come up from the Trent, and the horses had some difficulty finding their path. With a curse, the farmer woke and whipped the beasts.The horses charged foward, straight into the ox-bow lake (the old course of the River Trent).They were immediately sucked under and were never seen again. Now on dark, stormy nights the cart and horses can still be heard by anyone brave or stupid enough to be over the Holmes.The sounds of the horses screams are still carried on the wind to the village on such nights.
